chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M Hernke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as follows:  $2600 to Valerie S. (apply cash bail of $250 to Valeries restitution), $656.56 to Jason F. and $12,453 to American Family Insurance.  All restitution to be paid from any prison monies per statute and to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervsion.  Restitution to be paid BEFORE any costs/fines.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain employment deemed appropriate by Agent.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate and any medication compliance.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Use only one pharmacy.
No contact with Valerie S., Stephanie S., Nicholas W., Jason F. or their residences.
No contact with any Menards store.
NO CONTACT with Danield E. (co-actor).
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid licesne.

Cases 14CT587, 13CF1473 and 14CF43 were dismissed and read in.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are waived.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison

is should be noted that the defendant is eligible for for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  The Written Determininate of Sentence is correct.  The minutes from 06/19/14 are not modified but a Corrected JOC as to Count 1 will be done due to clerk error.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 6/19/14 plea and sentencing. (filed in 14CF474)
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Lisa M Hernke in court, in custody, with attorney Robert J Penegor.   Jayne D Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1, 2, and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1, 2 and 3.  Counts 4 and 5  are dismissed and read in.  
Victim appeared and made a statement. 
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:
COUNT 1:
IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

3 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 97 days)
  -  1 YEAR 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions and use only 1 pharmacy.
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Obtain employment deemed appropriate by agent.
*No contact with:  Valerie S., Stephanie S., Nicholas W., Jason F. or their residences, any Menards store.  NO contact with Daniel E. (co-actor).  
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done waive surcharges. 
*No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate and any medication compliance.
*Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. 

RESTITUTION:  
$2600 to Valerie S. (apply cash bail on hand to Valerie's restitution);
$656.56 to Jason F.;
$12,453 to American Family Insurance;
(All restitution to be paid from any prison monies per statute and as a condition of extended supervision - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

COURT COSTS:  waived.

DNA SURCHARGE:  waived.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

*******
COUNT 2:  

JAIL:  9 MONTHS, Concurrent with count 3.  Consecutive to count 1.  

COSTS:  waived.

*******
COUNT 3:  

JAIL:  9 MONTHS, Concurrent with count 2.  Consecutive to count 1.  

COSTS:  waived.
